intro: Microcos tetrasperma, commonly known as the four-seeded microcos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and have a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. The fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release four small, smooth seeds.
